newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian police intensify dig at sex-scandal house.
newsitem.headline: Belgian police intensify dig at sex-scandal house.

text.p: Police on Tuesday intensified digging at a house owned by Marc Dutroux, chief suspect in Belgium's child-murder and sex-abuse scandal.

Neighbours told Reuters they saw a handcuffed Dutroux brought to the house late on Monday, where he stayed until about 1 a.m. on Tuesday. The house was inhabited at one time by Dutroux' accused accomplice Bernard Weinstein.
Early on Tuesday, about 30 police officers brought an excavator and what looked like high-tech search equipment to the house, neighbours said.
The entire area was cordoned off, while two police helicopters hovered overhead.
Dutroux has been charged with abduction and illegal imprisonment.
Just over a week ago, the bodies of eight-year-olds Melissa Russo and Julie Lejeune, and of Bernard Weinstein himself were found buried in the garden of another house belonging to Dutroux.
